_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Meat and Meat Product Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Buckhead Beef of Florida

1. Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies:

We at Buckhead Beef of Florida are committed to employee, public and environmental safety.  This commitment is demonstrated by our comprehensive accidental release prevention program that covers areas such as the design, installation, operating procedures, maintenance, and employee training associated with the ammonia refrigeration system at our facility.  It is our policy to implement appropriate control measures to prevent releases of Ammonia (anhydrous).  Unforseeably, if such a release does occur, our highly trained employees are on hand to mitigate the effects of the release.  We are also completely coordinated with the Auburndale Fire Department, who provides our emergency response services.

2. The Stationary Source and the Regulated Substances Handled:

We have one regulated substance present at our facility.  That substance is Ammonia (anhydrous).  The maximum inventory that is expected to be present in this facility, based on process and operational requirements is 27,000 pounds.

3. The General Accidental Release Prevention Program and the Chemical Specific Prevention Steps:

Our facility has taken the following steps as required by 40CFR Part 68 of the EPA's Clean Air Act.  Our Ammonia (anhydrous) process is also subject to the OSHA Process Safety Management regulation 29CFR1910.119 and the Emergency Planning and Community Right To Know Act (EPCRA) Seciton 302 requirements.  The following sections briefly describe the elements of the accidental release prevention program that is in place at our facility:

Process Safety Information:

Our facility conducts comprehensive studies to ensure that hazards associated with our ammonia refrigeration process are identified and controlled efficiently.  The methodology used to conduct these analyses is the What-If Checklist.  The studies are conducted by a team of qualified personnel with expertise in engineering and process

operations and are revalidated at a regular interval of at least every five years.  Any findings related to the hazard analyses are addressed in a timely manner.

Operating Procedures:

Buckhead Beef of Florida maintains written operating and maintenance procedures.  These procedures address various modes of operation such as initial start-up, normal operations, temporary operations, emergency shutdown, emergency operations, normal shutdown, and start-up after a turnaround.  The information is regularly reviewed and is readily accessible to personnel involved in operating or maintaining the ammonia refrigeration system.

Training:

Buckhead Beef of Florida has a comprehensive training program in place to ensure that employees who are operating or maintaining the ammonia refrigeration system are competent.  New employees receive basic classroom training in process operations, followed by on-the-job supervision until they are deemed competent to work independently.  Refresher training is provided at least annually and more frequently as needed.

Mechanical Integrity:

Buckhead Beef of Florida carries out highly documented maintenance checks on process equipment to ensure proper operation.  Process equipment examined by these checks includes pressure vessels, storage tanks, piping systems, relief and vent systems, emergency shutdown systems, controls and pumps.  The personnel who conduct these maintenance operations have specialized training in maintenance practices.  Furthermore, these personnel are given specialized training as needed.  Any equipment deficiencies identified during the maintenance checks are corrected in a safe and timely manner.

Management of Change:

Written procedures are in place at Buckhead Beef of Florida to manage changes in process chemicals, technology, equipment and processes.  Process operators, maintenance personnel, or any other employees whose job tasks are affected by a modification in process operations, are promptly made aware of, a

nd given, training to deal with the modifications.

Compliance Audits:

Buckhead Beef of Florida conducts audits on a regular basis to determine whether the requirements of the Process Safety Management and Risk Management Planning regulations are being implemented.  These audits are conducted at least every three years and any corrective actions required as a result of these audits are completed in a safe and timely manner.

Incident Investigation:

Buckhead Beef of Florida promptly investigates any incident that has resulted in, or could reasonably have resulted in a catastrophic release of Ammonia (anhydrous).  These investigations are conducted to identify the situation leading to the incident, as well as any corrective actions to prevent the incident from recurring.  All investigation reports are retained for a minimum of five years.

Employee Participation:

Buckhead Beef of Florida believes that Process Safety and Risk Management compliance requires a team effort.  Company employees are strongly urged to express their views concerning accident prevention issues and to recommend improvements.  In addition, our employees have access to all information created as a part of the facility's implementation of the Process Safety and Risk Management Planning regulations, including information resulting from the process hazard analyses, in particular.

Contractors:

On occasion, Buckhead Beef of Florida hires contractors to conduct specialized maintenance and construction activities.  Prior to selecting contractors, a thorough evaluation of the contractor's safety performance is conducted.  Buckhead Beef of Florida has a strict policy of informing contractors of known potential hazards releated to the contractor's work and the ammonia refrigeration system.  Contractors are also informed of all the procedures for emergency notification, evacuation and employee accountability, should an accidental release of Ammonia (anhydrous) occur.

4. 5-Year Accident History:

There

have been no accidents or incidents at this facility during the past 5 years.

5. Emergency Response Plan:

Buckhead Beef of Florida is included in the written community emergency response plan.  The facility also has it's own emergency response plan.  The emergency response plan includes specific actions to be taken in response to an accidental release of Ammonia (anhydrous).  The emergency response plan includes procedures for informing the public and local response agencies of a release of Ammonia (anhydrous).  The emergency response plan also includes information for emergency health care.

The date of the most recent review or update of the emergency response plan was: 1-12-09

The date of the most recent emergency response training of employees was: 1-11-10

The local agency coordinating the facility emergency response plan is the Auburndale Fire Department, which has the telephone number: 863-965-5527      

6. Planned Changes to Improve Safety:

Several developments and findings have resulted from the implementation of the various elements of our accidental release prevention program.  We will continue our annual facility evacuation drills and planning and training site visits with the Auburndale Fire Department in the future.
